intro: Fimbristylis abbreviata, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Fimbristylis abbreviata plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
